content: Any FHIR value set and code system for covid vaccine codes for "Sputnik V", "Astra Zeneka" and Chinese "Sinopharm/Sinovac"?
CVX code 210 is the Astra Zeneca vaccine (https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/programs/iis/COVID-19-related-codes.html)

WHO / SVC uses this list of ICD11 codes: https://who-int.github.io/svc/refs/heads/rc2/ValueSet-who-svc-vaccines.html - that are generic, so if you know the technology the vaccine use you can pick a code from there
Sputnik V is 'non replicating viral vector' I guess? so XM9QW8 (?)

http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/StructureDefinition-vaccination-credential-immunization.html#identifying-vaccines would then say (in right most column) that manufacturer would be required. http://build.fhir.org/ig/dvci/vaccine-credential-ig/branches/main/StructureDefinition-vaccination-credential-immunization.html#vaccine-manufacturer shows two approaches: MVX or GLN. Does Sputnik V have a GLN?
This is the SVC stream so the manufacturer is not required!

rc2 will have a coded manufacturer. @Luke Duncan i thought it was going to be required....
https://who-int.github.io/svc/refs/heads/rc2-umbrella/StructureDefinition-SVC-Core-Data-Set.html
I don't know that WHO will require a specific value set for the manufacturers though.
(at least not in the short term)
